verses.verse: To the chief <S%H5329><s%> Musician, <S%H5329><s%> Altaschith, <S%H516><s%> Michtam <S%H4387><s%> of David. <S%H1732><s%> Do you indeed <S%H552><s%> speak <S%H1696><s%> righteousness, <S%H6664><s%> O congregation? <S%H482><s%> do you judge <S%H8199><s%> uprightly, <S%H4339><s%> O you sons <S%H1121><s%> of men? <S%H120><s%>
Yes, <S%H637><s%> in heart <S%H3820><s%> you work <S%H6466><s%> wickedness; <S%H5766><s%> you weigh <S%H6424><s%> the violence <S%H2555><s%> of your hands <S%H3027><s%> in the earth. <S%H776><s%>

The wicked <S%H7563><s%> are estranged <S%H2114><s%> from the womb: <S%H7358><s%> they go <S%H8582><s%> astray <S%H8582><s%> as soon as they be born, <S%H990><s%> speaking <S%H1696><s%> lies. <S%H3576><s%>

Their poison <S%H2534><s%> is like <S%H1823><s%> the poison <S%H2534><s%> of a serpent: <S%H5175><s%> they are like <S%H3644><s%> the deaf <S%H2795><s%> adder <S%H6620><s%> that stops <S%H331><s%> her ear; <S%H241><s%>
Which <S%H834><s%> will not listen <S%H8085><s%> to the voice <S%H6963><s%> of charmers, <S%H3907><s%> charming <S%H2266><s%> <S%H2267><s%> never so wisely. <S%H2449><s%>

Break <S%H2040><s%> their teeth, <S%H8127><s%> O God, <S%H430><s%> in their mouth: <S%H6310><s%> break <S%H5422><s%> out the great <S%H4459><s%> teeth <S%H4973><s%> of the young <S%H3715><s%> lions, <S%H3715><s%> O LORD. <S%H3068><s%>

Let them melt <S%H3988><s%> away as waters <S%H4325><s%> which run <S%H1980><s%> continually: when he bends <S%H1869><s%> his bow to shoot his arrows, <S%H2671><s%> let them be as cut <S%H4135><s%> in pieces.

As a snail <S%H7642><s%> which melts, <S%H8557><s%> let every one of them pass <S%H1980><s%> away: like the untimely <S%H5309><s%> birth <S%H5309><s%> of a woman, <S%H802><s%> that they may not see <S%H2372><s%> the sun. <S%H8121><s%>

Before <S%H2962><s%> your pots <S%H5518><s%> can feel <S%H995><s%> the thorns, <S%H329><s%> he shall take <S%H8175><s%> them away as with a whirlwind, <S%H8175><s%> both living, <S%H2416><s%> and in his wrath. <S%H2740><s%>

The righteous <S%H6662><s%> shall rejoice <S%H8055><s%> when <S%H3588><s%> he sees <S%H2372><s%> the vengeance: <S%H5359><s%> he shall wash <S%H7364><s%> his feet <S%H6471><s%> in the blood <S%H1818><s%> of the wicked. <S%H7563><s%>

So that a man <S%H120><s%> shall say, <S%H559><s%> Truly <S%H389><s%> there is a reward <S%H6529><s%> for the righteous: <S%H6662><s%> truly <S%H389><s%> he is a God <S%H430><s%> that judges <S%H8199><s%> in the earth. <S%H776><s%>
